Question 52) Caustic soda can be used in the unclogging of domestic pipelines and has, in its composition, sodium hydroxide as the main component, as well as some impurities. The soda is usually marketed in solid form, but which has a “melted” aspect when exposed to the air for a certain period.
The phenomenon of "melting" stems from the
A) Absorption of moisture present in atmospheric air.
B) fusion of hydroxide by heat exchange with the environment.
C) reaction of the impurities of the product with the oxygen of the air.
D) adsorption of atmospheric gases on the surface of the solid.
E) reaction of sodium hydroxide with nitrogen gas present in the air.
